description.plain: Jamie xx is one third of the mysterious Indie pop band, The xx. He is a producer and DJ, and released a collaborative album with Gil Scott-Heron, We’re New Here in 2011, a remix album of Scott-Heron’s 2010 comeback album, I’m New Here.

body.plain: Jamie xx is one third of the mysterious Indie pop band, The xx. He is a producer and DJ, and released a collaborative album with Gil Scott-Heron, We’re New Here in 2011, a remix album of Scott-Heron’s 2010 comeback album, I’m New Here.

songs.full_title: I Know There's Gonna Be (Good Times) by Jamie xx (Ft. Popcaan & Young Thug)
songs.title: I Know There’s Gonna Be (Good Times)
songs.title_with_featured: I Know There's Gonna Be (Good Times) (Ft. Popcaan & Young Thug)

description.plain:
The xx’s own Jamie xx released his solo debut In Colour, grabbing Popcaan and man-of-the-moment Young Thug for an assist with “I Know There’s Gonna Be (Good Times).”

The song was met with universal acclaim from multiple publications and featured prominently on year-end lists. The track ranked second on PopMatters' 90 Best Songs of 2015, third on Pitchfork’s top-100 tracks, tied-for-ninth on the Village Voice’s Pazz & Jop poll, and was selected as one of Stereogum’s 80 best songs of 2015.

songs.embed_content: Read “I Know There's Gonna Be (Good Times)” by Jamie xx on Genius
songs.recording_location: Fortress Studios (London, UK) and Marfa Recording Co. (Marfa, TX)

body.plain:
The xx’s own Jamie xx released his solo debut In Colour, grabbing Popcaan and man-of-the-moment Young Thug for an assist with “I Know There’s Gonna Be (Good Times).”

The song was met with universal acclaim from multiple publications and featured prominently on year-end lists. The track ranked second on PopMatters' 90 Best Songs of 2015, third on Pitchfork’s top-100 tracks, tied-for-ninth on the Village Voice’s Pazz & Jop poll, and was selected as one of Stereogum’s 80 best songs of 2015.

songs.full_title: Loud Places by Jamie xx (Ft. Romy)
songs.title: Loud Places

description.plain:
“Loud Places” was the fourth song released in advance of Jamie xx’s 2015 album, In Colour, which followed the “Girl” / “Sleep Sound” single released the previous year. The track features vocals from Romy Madley Croft, Jamie’s bandmate in The xx.

“Loud Places” was initially released as a single alongside “Gosh”, which also appeared on In Colour.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TP9luRtEqjc

songs.embed_content: Read “Loud Places” by Jamie xx on Genius

40 ContributorsLoud Places Lyrics[Verse 1: Romy]

To search for someone
To be quiet with
Who will take me home
You go to loud places
To find someone who
Will take you higher than
I took you
[Chorus: Romy]
Didn't I take you to
Higher places you can't reach without me?
(I have never reached such heights) Reach without me
(I feel music in your eyes
I have never reached such heights)
[Verse 2: Romy]
I go to those places
Where we used to go
They seem so quiet now
I'm here, all alone

With I don't know who
And I don't know how
To follow you

Higher
I take you higher and I’ll take you
Didn’t I take you higher?
I take you higher
I take you higher and I take you
Didn’t I take you higher?
I take you
[Chorus: Romy]
Didn't I take you to

(I feel music in your eyes
I have never reached such heights)
(I feel music in your eyes
I have never reached such heights
I feel music in your eyes
I have never reached such heights)

[Outro: Romy]
You're in ecstasy without me
When you come down
I won't be aroundYou might also like69Embed

songs.full_title: Girl by Jamie xx
songs.title: Girl

description.plain: “Girl” is an upbeat dance track that, along with its AA-side “Sleep Sound”, later appeared on Jamie xx’s debut solo album, In Colour. “Girl” complements “Sleep Sound” both musically and structurally.

songs.embed_content: Read “Girl” by Jamie xx on Genius
songs.recording_location: Fortress Studios (London, UK) and Marfa Recording Co. (Marfa, TX)
